PSI College of Engineering North Carolina State University Office: Room 2407, EB III Email: yuchen.liu AT ncsu.edu Phone: +1 919-515-3412 Official Website Biography I received my Ph.D. degree at the Georgia Institute of Technology, worked with Dr. Douglas M. Blough in the Critical Networking Lab. I am currently a tenure-track Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at North Carolina State University (NCSU). My research focuses on advancing user-centric applications through ubiquitous networking and intelligence, encompassing networks, machine learning, computing, and communications: networking and systems (wireless networks, digital twins, Open RAN, and cybersecurity) machine learning for data, networks, security and privacy (generative AI, LLM, distributed/reinforcement learning, multi-modal data) mobile computing (UAVs, autonomous sensing, networked agentic systems) new communication paradigms (mmWave, THz, nextG Wi-Fi) optimization and reasoning (resilience theory, foundation models and applied systems) software development and simulation (differentiable and portable simulators, open-source testbeds) These research works have been recognized by NSF CAREER Award (2025), NVIDIA Academic Awards (2025), National AI Research Resource Pilot Award (2025), NCSU Carla Savage Award (2025), IEEE IPCCC Best Paper Award Runner-up (2024), IFIP Networking Best Paper Award Runner-up (2024), IEEE ICCCN Best Paper Award (2023), ACM MobiWac Best Paper Award (2022), IEEE LANMAN Best Paper Award (2022), IEEE LCN Best Paper Award Second Place (2020), and ACM MSWiM Best Paper Award Finalist (2019). Our ongoing research and educational efforts are also supported by NSF CNS (#2312138), NSF SaTC (#2350075), and NSF NAIRR Supplement (#2506757) grants.
